meanings.definition: A device that measures the rate of something.
meanings.sent1: The ratemeter showed how fast the car was going.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used the ratemeter to track the speed of the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The ratemeter beeped happily when it recorded the flow rate.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a ratemeter, constantly monitoring the changing scenery.
meanings.sent5: The ratemeter hummed softly as it calculated the heartbeat.

meanings.definition: To measure the rate of something using a ratemeter.
meanings.sent1: He will ratemeter the water flow in the pipes tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She ratemetered the production line to ensure efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The chef ratemetered the ingredients for the perfect recipe.
meanings.sent4: Time ratemetered the seconds ticking away like a relentless clock.
meanings.sent5: The teacher ratemetered the students' progress with precision.
